intro: Nymphoides sivarajanii, commonly known as the Sivarajan's water lily, is a rare aquatic plant native to the wetlands of southern India. It belongs to the Pontederiaceae family and is characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often forming dense mats on the water surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
